Posts.Content: judytheq wrote:   I just had a right breast masectomy on August 18th and am now choosing treatments to prevent recurrence.  I have a 21% chance of cancer returning in 10 years.  This is reduced to 9.9% with hormone therapy that I will do.  Chemotherapy will bring the number down to 5.2%.  I am 49 years old.  Trying to decide if the benefit of chemotherapy is worth it. The thought of the cancer returning is terrifying.  I am also so ready to be done and moving on with my life.  No strong preference from my doctor.  These numbers came from additional Oncotype testing.  Was hoping for something that would make choosing easier.    Dx 7/6/2011, ILC, 2cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: chemotherapy choice judytheq mdg
